org.microbean.jersey.netty

Class ByteBufChunkedInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.jersey.netty.ByteBufChunkedInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChunkedInput<ByteBuf>

    public class ByteBufChunkedInput
extends Object
implements ChunkedInput<ByteBuf>
    A ChunkedInput implementation that reads from a ByteBuf.

    Thread Safety

    Instances of this class are safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the operations performed on the ByteBuf instance retained by this class are not guaranteed to be threadsafe. This class assumes that it will be invoked on Netty's event loop thread.

    Author:
    Laird Nelson

      • ByteBufChunkedInput

        public ByteBufChunkedInput(ByteBuf byteBuf)
        Creates a new ByteBufChunkedInput whose length() method will return -1L.
        Parameters:
        byteBuf - the ByteBuf from which chunks will be read; must not be null
        See Also:
        ByteBufChunkedInput(ByteBuf, long)

      • ByteBufChunkedInput

        public ByteBufChunkedInput(ByteBuf byteBuf,
                           long lengthToReport)
        Creates a new ByteBufChunkedInput.
        Parameters:
        byteBuf - the ByteBuf from which chunks will be read; must not be null
        lengthToReport - the length of this ChunkedInput implementation in bytes to be reported by the length() method; may be -1L (and very often is) if a representation of its length is not available.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if byteBuf is null

      • readChunk

        @Deprecated
public final ByteBuf readChunk(ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext)
        Deprecated. Please use the readChunk(ByteBufAllocator) method instead.
        Calls the readChunk(ByteBufAllocator) method and returns its result.

        This method may and often does return null.

        Specified by:
        readChunk in interface ChunkedInput<ByteBuf>
        Parameters:
        channelHandlerContext - a ChannelHandlerContext whose ChannelHandlerContext.alloc() method is invoked to acquire a ByteBufAllocator; may be null
        Returns:
        a ByteBuf representing a chunk of the overall data, or null

      • readChunk

        public final ByteBuf readChunk(ByteBufAllocator ignoredByteBufAllocator)
        Returns a ByteBuf representing a chunk of this ByteBufChunkedInput's overall input as represented by the ByteBuf supplied to it at construction time.

        This method may, and often does, return null.

        Specified by:
        readChunk in interface ChunkedInput<ByteBuf>
        Parameters:
        ignoredByteBufAllocator - a ByteBufAllocator that this implementation ignores; may be null
        Returns:
        a ByteBuf representing a chunk of this ByteBufChunkedInput's overall input as represented by the ByteBuf supplied to it at construction time, or null
        See Also:
        getChunkSize(ByteBuf)

      • getChunkSize

        protected int getChunkSize(ByteBuf source)
        Returns the size of the chunk, in bytes, that will be returned by the readChunk(ByteBufAllocator) method.

        This implementation returns the result of invoking source.readableBytes().

        Parameters:
        source - the ByteBuf that was supplied at construction time; will not be null
        Returns:
        the size of the chunk, in bytes, that will be returned by the readChunk(ByteBufAllocator) method
        See Also:
        readChunk(ByteBufAllocator)

      • length

        public final long length()
        Returns the length of this ChunkedInput implementation in bytes, or -1L if a representation of its length is not available.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

        the number of bytes read from this input

      • close

        public final void close()
        Marks this ByteBufChunkedInput as being closed.

        As a result the readChunk(ByteBufAllocator) method may return null in the future.

        Specified by:
        close in interface ChunkedInput<ByteBuf>
        See Also:
        readChunk(ByteBufAllocator)
